  1. A tasteful video for your palate featuring Polk County's incredible scenic wine county!
    WATCH THE VIDEO!



    Travel Salem has produced a new video showcasing Polk County. Polk County is located in Oregon's Mid-Willamette Valley. It's a remarkable place where social hour is held at the vineyard, stars outshine street lights and going to the market means meeting the farmer. Plan your trip to Dallas now!

    Watch the video here!

  1. CITY MANAGER RECRUITMENT

    The City of Dallas is in search for a new City Manager and with direction from the City Council and working with the Mid-Willamette Valley Council of Governments below is the criteria.

    Profile
    Process



    2019 Schedule and Recycling Info



    Here is the 2019 Schedule and Recycling Info




    Why should I be ready?


    Emergencies happen all the time and knowing what to do before, during and after an emergency improves your odds of a positive outcome. Our emergency notifications send updated alerts directly to you keeping you informed on rapidly changing situations.

    How do I sign up?


    It’s easy! Simply click the link above and create a username and password. Then we’ll send updated alerts through email, voice, or text. 

  1. WATER DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM FLUSHING

    Area of work being done: Currently (4/9/19), North of West Ellendale from NW Douglas St to the West Side of Jasper Ave, to NW Reed Ln. Also from West Ellendale to SW Walnut St, between SW Levens to Main St. Prior to replace your meter, City crews will knock on your door to make sure it is a good time to interrupt your water service.

    Frequently asked questions about the Water Meter Replacement Project: Time frame: Meter Replacement requires 15 to 20 minutes for the installation under typical conditions. 

    Additional Information: City Crews are doing the project with limited man power. Performing existing duties and responding to foreseen incidents will determined how quickly this area will be completed.

    The City of Dallas continues to upgrade our water meter system by installing automated meter reading, or AMR to the remainder of the City. This technology allows us to automatically and
    remotely collect data from your water meter and transfer that data to City Hall for billing, troubleshooting, and analyzing. This new system will increase efficiency, reduce water loss, and help limit future utility rate increases.






    Frequently asked questions about the Water Meter Replacement Project:

    Time frame: Meter Replacement requires 15 to 20 minutes for the
    installation under typical conditions.  

    Area of work being done: Currently, South of West Ellendale and West
    of Lyle Softball complex. Prior to replace your meter, City crews will
    knock on your door to make sure it is a good time to interrupt your
    water service.

    Additional Information: City Crews are doing the project with limited
    man power. Performing existing duties and responding to foreseen
    incidents will determined how quickly this area will be completed. 



    The City of Dallas is excited to announce phase 2 of upgrading
    our water meter system by installing automated meter reading,
    or AMR to the remainder of the City. This technology allows us
    to automatically and remotely collect data from your water meter
    and transfer that data to City Hall for billing, troubleshooting, and
    analyzing. This new system will increase efficiency, reduce water
    loss, and help limit future utility rate increases.


    During this process, it is not necessary to be home during the
    change out, but you can anticipate a brief interruption in water
    service while the work is being done. City of Dallas staff will
    contact you at your residence prior to beginning work to ensure
    that it is a good time to shut off the water. If you prefer, you may
    call the Public Works Department at 503.831.3559 and schedule
    your water shut off time if you would like a certain day, or time
    of day. 

    After the meter replacement, customers should not notice any
    significant change in their water service. If a very old water
    meter was replaced the new meter may show a more accurate
    representation of usage; old water meters wear out and do
    not work as well.  

    Thank you for your patience during this water system
    improvement. If you have any questions, please contact
    the Public Works Department 503.831.3559.

    Sincerely,
    Jake Dyer
    Water Utilities Supervisor

  1. Alis Volat Propiis
    “She flies with her own wings”



    The Dallas Arts Association is partnering with the City of Dallas and the
    Dallas Downtown Association to present an exciting opportunity to
    celebrate Oregon’s motto with a unique
    and creativity opportunity for the entire community.
    This contest would consist of age categories broken into brackets.
    Each age bracket will be voted on via Facebook on the
    Dallas Community Bulletin Board and the City of Dallas pages
    ultimately determining the 3 winners for each group.

    Groups Include:
    Kindergarten - 5th grade, Middle School, High School, Adults

    Design entry period if over.begins November 1 and runs until January 18
    Community voting began April 8 and will run through April 19
    Winners will be announced at the May 6 City Council meeting

    Contest Application
